headline: Pasta Primavera with Italian Turkey Sausage
description: A delicious dish created from the fresh bounty of my garden. My whole family has seconds when we have this meal!
name: Pasta Primavera with Italian Turkey Sausage
recipeIngredient: 1 pound hot Italian turkey sausage, cut into 1/2 inch slices

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Place farfalle in pot and cook 8 to 10 minutes, until al dente; drain.

Place sausage in a large skillet over medium heat and cook until evenly brown; set aside. Heat 1/4 cup oil in skillet. Stir in garlic and onion, and cook until tender. Mix in zucchini, squash, tomatoes, bell pepper and basil. Dissolve bouillon in the mixture. Season with red pepper. Stir in remaining oil. Continue cooking 10 minutes.
Mix pasta, sausage and cheese into skillet. Continue cooking 5 minutes, or until heated through.

review.reviewBody: I put less oil and I felt it still was too oily. I toasted up some panko breadcrumbs and sprinkled them on top before serving.
i replaced summer sqash with yellow pepper and did not add any red pepper flakes. Everyone loves it. Thanks
Great summer recipe for a farm market visit. I used colored rotini. Next batch will have some dried oregano.
This pasta primavera was yum! Have made it once and my while family liked it!
One of my favorites. I added spinach and used Rotel Tomatoes . I would recommend not using the whole box of noodles. I kept complimenting the Chef, which was me!
This recipe was delicious! I made it for the first time tonight and my children really enjoyed it.
It does not need so much oil! But the flavor was incredible and it's got lots of veggies (we used veggies pasta). Going to keep making this again and again work half the oil.
My entire family loved it!

I love this so much! It is even good without the meat (I added mine last). I made a few changes based on what I had in the house. Two cans diced tomatoes, drained, instead of fresh Roma. Lots of dried instead of fresh basil. Chickpea pasta, and chicken instead of sausage, though I’m sure it would be even better with sausage. This is a yummy one! Add less red pepper flakes if you’re not a fan of heat.
This was really good. Very hearty. Think I will reduce the pasta next time to 1/2 to 2/3 of recipe.

Excellent concept for a variety of vegetables. I used what I had readily available: onion, summer squash, carrots, zebra cocktail tomatoes, artichokes, chard, globe basil, thyme, oregano, rosemary, sauteed with olive oil, coconut oil, a tablespoon of butter for flavor cooked sweet Italian sausage. Combined the pasta with meat, vegetables, a touch of chile powder, and pasta water and shredded parm. I needed to use a few more vegetables. 
Lots of flexibility

I did make some slight changes. I used Italian sausage out of the casing. Broccoli florets in place of squash since my husband doesn't like squash and broccoli is borderline ok for him. Also, 15 leaves of basil chopped. I added 2 tablespoons of flour to thicken the juices. I don't like green bell pepper, the flavor is too strong for me, so I used an orange bell pepper. I will stick to yellow, orange or red. The flavor of this recipe was great! Didn't add any salt or pepper cause this recipe didn't need it. The veggies, basil and little bit of red pepper flakes make this very yummy! My husband like it enough to have 3 helpings! I will be making this again for sure! Oh, I made the 6 serving size and my 4 qt dutch oven handled it with ease.
This dish is so good! Lots of flavor. I used fresh vegetables picked from of my garden made and it so fresh testing! I didn’t change a thing and was really pleased with the results!!!

This was very, very good and so fresh and easy. The only change I made was to add some steamed green beans red instead of green bell peppers and instead of bouillon granules, I use "better than bouillon". I also added a few dollops of cream cheese because I had some I needed to use and it made it creamier. I also used rigatoni because that is what I had. The family loved and it is very economical as well! Thanks for sharing!
We really liked this. It was a quick & easy summer meal. Add more red pepper if you like it hot. Thanks for the recipe!
My family loves this recipe. It’s easy to make and I can use vegetables from the garden during the summer.

5 stars with the following adjustments: 
1) double all veggies
2) use only 11oz pasta
2) To do it w/o Itallian sausage), I made my own Itallian seasoning mix: 1.5tsp oregano, 1tsp thyme, 3tsp dried basil (and then didn't use fresh in the pasta because I didn't have it -- if I'd had fresh basil to use I would have only put in 1/2 tsp), 1/2tsp rosemary, 1/4tsp sage, 3/4tsp blk pepper, 1/2tsp paprika, 1/2tsp onion powder, 1/2tsp garlic powder, and 1tsp salt. Whizzed this with stick blender till fine & add with tomatoes.
3) 1/4 tsp harissa Arbi instead of red pepper flakes
Delicious - I made a few changes
Simple and yummy. I didn't have farfelle but it went great with orzo.

My family loved this dish! We eat plant based in our home, so I used plant based Italian sausage, instead of turkey meat/sausage, vegan cream cheese with oat milk mixed together which another user added to their recipe but not plant based. I’ll definitely make this again and again.
Delicious, hearty, and full of wonderful veggies. You can make it without the pasta if you are watching carbs, and it’s still filling and wonderful.
I used rigatoni and added a bit more spice. It was the first time I cooked for my mother and she genuinely enjoyed it!

i used turkey sausage and also did not have the fresh basil so i used dried-. we have a garlic chicken rub that i use on veggies so i used that too-hubby does not like squash or zucchini but he really like this-i am making it again but using zuchini noodles-and i use a refridgerated bouillion-i thank you for this recipe-it is going in my summer garden recipe ;ist
Great start, but I adapted it some to make a smaller batch. Used 1/2 the squash, pepper (red) & pasta, only 1 to 2 Tablespoons oil & white wine for additional liquid. So delicious!!

Made this for my family tonight and they loved it! So did it. It was fairly easy to make. I didn’t use all the noodles or any Parmesan but that’s just my personal preference. Can’t wait to eat left overs for lunch. Will definitely make again!
This recipe is easy and delicious as is. We use Herbox bouillon so it is very low sodium and hot Italian chicken sausage. Yummy.
Excellent! I had a hard time finding hot Italian turkey sausage, but found it at Whole Foods. Very flavorful.
Made with vegetable stock rather than chicken. Loved it!

Really good, but too spicy! I will cut the red pepper flakes down next time. I substituted chicken for the sausage, a splash of chicken broth instead of the bouillon, and used a 15oz can of diced tomatoes (suggested in another review), both of which worked wonderfully.

Anything all six of my kids 17 down to 2 will eat and ask for seconds off deserves a positive review! We opted to not add as much pepper for personal tastes but otherwise, we stayed true to the posted recipe. It was delightful!
I enjoyed this light yet flavorful meal. I used Italian chicken sausage instead of the turkey.
Loved it. Did follow others with the use of a can of diced tomatoes. That was my only change. The whole family loved it.
This was easy and my whole family loved it!

Quite delicious and easy. I made the following changes: added mushrooms, added canned Italian tomatoes, used chicken sausage. I also just cooked the sausage and veggies all together. I just put the sausage in first, then mushrooms 6-8 mins later, and then the veggies 5 mins later. Mixed it all up in one put with the Parmesan and a small bit of marinara. Huge hit!
Great dish, I substituted green for orange bell pepper and breakfast sausage instead of turkey. It was great!
This recipe was a big hit with my family. I used avocado oil instead of olive oil but that was my only substitution.
I made this tonight for dinner. It came out great!!!! I added eggplant and instead of cooking the veggies in oil. I cooked them in chicken broth
This is a keeper! I made it with linguine, as that is what I had on hand, and lots of fresh basil ...and freshly grated parmesan. Very fresh tasting.
Loved the fresh taste of the vegetables. Fresh basil made this very tasty. Will make it again.

I love one dish meals and this one is a keeper. I did use the canned flavored tomatoes and only 1/4 cup of olive oil, everything else as directed. The family loved it. Will definitely make this again and soon. Very tasty and versatile.
So good!!
I didn't make any changes, it was delicious with all the fresh summer veggies! Definitely will make it again.
I did it with zucchini noodles

The first time I make a recipe, I follow it perfectly, with a few exceptions. I cooked the sausage on my grill because it is cooked before the veggies. The boxes of pasta they sell here only have 12 oz. The recipe calls for 16 oz. I only used the 12 oz box, but that seemed to be enough. 

This had a wonderful flavor. Its a great summer dish. There are only two of us this time of year, but I made the full recipe. Needless to say we will have some excellent leftovers later this week.

This was so good!
There is only 2 of us, So we had it for leftovers and it was just as good the second and third day.
Loved this! Only changed the pasta to penne, added a little more garlic and a serrano pepper diced fine, and I used better than bouillon because that's all I had, it's a keeper!

This is a perfect recipe. I made a few changes and add more or different veggies each time. My hubby isn’t a fan of zucchini, so I had half each of these bell peppers: red, yellow and orange to substitute. Love this recipe.
Family loved it, its on our make it again list
Very good. Followed the recipe except used canned tomatoes and took advice from another reviewer and put in some cream cheese. Delicious.
I added all sorts of vegetables...carrots, mushrooms, red peppers. I also put it on top of some Quinoa pasta that I got from Trader Joe's
I substituted chicken sausage or regular Italian sausage because I prefer those over anything turkey. This is basically a sausage recipe. You ca even use chorizo sausage

This turned out really good. It's important not to overcook the vegetables. I used fresh pappardelle, and used some white wine to deglaze the pan after cooking the onions and garlic. Used sweet yellow pepper instead of green, just a personal preference. Didn't need the whole 1/2 c of oil, just added a tablespoon of butter at the end. My husband loved it! This is a keeper

I used mild Italian sausage and Rainbow Rotini instead of the Farfalla pasta recommended in the recipe. I also used a whole Valdalia onion and six cloves of garlic. I used only three Roma plum tomatoes but replaced them with 1/2 sweet red bell pepper and 1/2 orange bell pepper. This made it super colorful. Also only used about 1/8 cup olive oil and that was plenty! This was so fresh and well seasoned it needed no extra salt or pepper and we served the shaved paramasean cheese on the side to sprinkle on top at the table. I think this adds to the color and don't recommend heating the cheese in the pasta as the last step of the published recipe instructs. It turned out brilliantly colorful with fantastic flavor! I made this dish that serves eight and fed four of us....it was nearly gone!! I will definitely repeat this!
Tasty but needs salt and pepper.

Made tonight for hubby and myself. This is a keeper! I really appreciate the suggestions of others and incorporated some of them. Used a 14.5 oz can of stewed tomatoes w/Italian herbs (undrained), broccoli, bell pepper, carrots and celery (cuz that's what I had on hand) in addition to the onions and garlic. Added some 4-cheese Italian blend and grated Asiago cheese, then freshly ground pepper. I also kept the pasta separate as I knew we'd have leftovers. To serve, I put some pasta in first, then spooned the veggie/meat /cheese mixture on top. Then I microwaved on high for 1 minute. Give it a stir. Absolutely yummy!
This recipe is really good! I left out the sausage for a meatless Monday dish. Delish!!!

This is an easy, delicious meal! I have made this exactly like the recipe several times and I have used different meats or different veggies, whatever is in the house. It always turns out perfect. We love this!

I was meal prepping for my daughter and I chose this one for its ease (as I was also making 5 other dishes). It came out great, with lots of flavor. I wanted to use the turkey sausage, but the regular Italian was half the price, so I went with that. I also used chick pea pasta, as that was what I had on hand. It was easy to freeze in single serve ziplock bags. I made half a recipe and it made 4 bags. I will definitely do this one again.
This dish is amazing and is a definate make again

Great recipe and was pretty quick to make. I tripled it for my family of 6 (2 adults and 4 kids who are between 2-7). I think I will cut back on the oil next time but I think it was flavorful and everyone finished, which is what I want!
I did make some changes to work with what I had in the house. I used regular Italian sausage, I also used Italian diced tomatoes and I added some kale at the end. Easy and super yummy.

This turned out so great! I made this for a special anniversary dinner for my boyfriend and it was so great!! I ended up cooking everything up earlier but had extra time before dinner time so I put it in a casserole pan and sprinkled some cheese on top and kept it in the oven on 100 degrees for the remaining time while I got ready and it tasted so good! Loved the squash in it as well.
I used Al Fresco chicken sausage instead of turkey sausage. Will be in the rotation from now on!

Like others, I did not have fresh tomatoes and used canned. I did not have a bell pepper. Used only 1/4 c oil. Otherwise followed recipe exactly. We love this. Will keep it in our rotation. What a great used of veggies. Thanks for a great one.
So simple and so yummy, totally recommend this recipe! Followed as directed except used diced tomatoes in place of cut romas- will definitely make again and again.

I put a little bit of low fat milk in to thicken the sauce a little, and replaced the bell pepper with white mushrooms because of personal preference. Has so many of my favorite ingredients to cook with and it was delicious - I will definitely make it again!
Loved the inspiration although I changed the following: chicken chipotle sausage, added artichoke hearts and green olives... used less of the tomatoes and zucchini but then regretted that decision.
This recipe was delicious! The only thing I did different was add some chicken broth.
So gooood! And feeds a slew of people! Will use this recipe again and again.

Fair amount of prep. The only yellow squash available was butter nut and thus quite hard. I would precook that to give it a running shot. As it was had to cook much longer than ten minutes to get it soft.
Result was marvelous - especially for a novice like me.
The kitchen did look like I'd killed the turkey there by the time I was done.
I'd give it a 5 star but I added some pasta sauce to thicken it a bit and give it more flavor. I also added some fresh broccoli,cauliflower, and mushrooms. Everyone loved it
I've made this dish several times and it is delicious. It does require a large pot for the final stage, I usually end up using a wok.
Very tasty, fresh and satisfying!
I made this "vegetarian" style but otherwise followed this recipe. Yum

This was delicious! I made a few minor changes, based on what I had on hand. I am sure this would be delicious as written. I used a different shaped pasta, sweet Italian turkey sausage, a whole onion, and dried basil. The recipe says it serves 8, but I am pretty sure it would serve a lot more. It seems like a perfect recipe to bring to a potluck.

This is a wonderful basic receipe that I changed to my tastes. Used both sweet and hot turkey sausages. Sautéed onion in EVOO and garlic and then threw in every veggie I had in the house! I used Italian seasoning and crushed red pepper and 1 cup of chicken broth and a can of garlic and basil diced tomatoes... Whole wheat pasta and wow, it was great.
Fantastic. I followed it for the most part but I used Italian mild sausage & tons of other veggies ie: snow peas ,carrots, cauliflower ect...
I usually make double pasta cause my husband is a pasta fiend. Instead of extra oil I use white cooking wine and cream of chicken soup. Still amazing!
This was surprisingly unreal! Absolutely delicious!

So tasty! I made it by cooking sausage (then set aside). Sautéed a whole onion and garlic in EVOO. Before the onion was completely sautéed, I added squash and zucchini. I added in 2 cans of Rotel (one regular and one mild). Added chicken bouillon and pepper. Then I put fresh basil, fresh parsley, fresh kale, and fresh spinach into the mix. I made tortellini stuffed with cheese (purchased from Costco) and mixed it all up. We topped it with parmesan cheese. Delicious!
I made this for my wife, minus the zucchini, wow! I never liked squash before this recipe! Truly delicious!

Added peaches for a sweet summer twist, which enhanced the flavor quite a bit. Otherwise, while I liked this recipe it was nothing outstanding. I think I'll add some additional fresh herbs next time and probably will add the basil at the end instead of wilting it in.

In 10 years of using Allrecipes, this one is by far my favorite dish. I love it and everyone around me loves it. It is my go to dish when making food for a lot of people. Its easy to substitute ingredients that you like or don't. Its hard to find turkey sausage, so I use Mild Italian Sausage. I also use more peppers and less of the harder to find vegetables. I sometimes make it for myself and eat it for lunch every day of the week, its that good!

Wonderful! Made changes, but not to many. Used 1/2 lb (4 links) sausage. Didn't use all the olive oil. Just used enough to brown sausage. Didn't need to add any to saute onion & garlic, and sliced baby bella mushrooms. Didn't have yellow squash. Used zucchini, carrots, red bell pepper. Don't used bullion cubes. Added a little bit (maybe 1/4 - 1/3 cup) low sod. chicken broth. Added a little cornstarch to thicken sauce before adding cheese, pasta and sausage back in. Used whole wheat pasta. Threw in some toasted pine nuts too.
This turned out very tasty. My husband loved it!
This was a good recipie i just had to add a little season salt, garlic powder and black pepper to get it to my taste preference.

We loved it. I did do a lot of add ons though. I used veggie bow-tie pasta (because that's what I had). Since it wasn't creamy enough for my taste I doubled the amount of parmessan cheese, added 1/2 cup of milk and 2 tablespoons of cream cheese. I'm not a fan of sausage so I used chicken and seasoned that with salt, pepper, and Cajun. Sooo good! I love this recipe it's a nice base and then you can get fancy with it if you wish.
I used boneless chicken breast, left out the red pepper, and used dried basil. But my wife and I loved it. I will definitely make this again!
Delicious and easy. We like spicier so I added a chopped jalapeño.
Delicious and easy. We like spicier so I added a chopped jalapeño.

Deliciously light and satisfying! I used crumbled basil & chicken sausages (casings removed) and ripe, sweet grape tomatoes (instead of romas). Also used chicken buillion paste (as I don't have granuals) and substituted asparagus for the yellow squash as it wasn't available at my store. I deglazed the pan with a little no-salt chicken broth after sautéing the sausages, onion and garlic (to get up all those yummy bits). Added the basil at the very end (otherwise it gets mushy) and mixed everything together for maybe 3 min over medium heat. Served it with the Parmesan cheese sprinkled on top - what a hit! Hubby absolutely loved it and I did too. Definitely company worthy!

I had made this using chicken sausage also. I don't particularly care for hot sausage so I used sweet sausage. When I don't have fresh tomatoes I use stewed tomatoes, this works pretty good. I definitely recommend this recipe. One review stated they put a little milk in at the end I tried this and it works well.

Love this recipe - made it 2-3 times
Have used chicken sausage/ Apple , whatever ppl prefer ( organic)
I always use yellow or orange pepper- tender & sweeter.
I even throw mushrooms in.
Healthy too. *****

This was so good, loved the mixture of veggies. I also added mushrooms like some of the others. Next time I think I'll use a tad more sausage, and I'll put in the onions & garlic along with the other veggies because they burnt immediately. But it still turned out pretty good!

Not only is this a great recipe, but it can be quite flexible too. I did not have any squash or zucchini in the house, so I used fresh asparagus. I had intended to include fresh mushrooms too, but forgot. I had to substitute dried for fresh basil also. No doubt, fresh basil would have made a huge difference, but as it was, even with dried basil and the other modifications (I didn't have time to get to the store), it was still excellent. Careful to taste before adding any salt. Maybe it's the salt in the Parmesan cheese, but the dish was plenty salty without adding any. Enjoy!

Love this!! I make it just like the recipe except that I omit the peppers because my kids don't like them and I use a 28 oz can of diced tomatoes instead of fresh and it is wonderful! Occasionally I add other veggies that I may have like fresh mushrooms asparagus or spinach. My whole family loves it and there are never any leftovers!

This is a pretty good recipe, but I had to modify slightly since my kids and I do not like spicy food. I omitted the red pepper flakes, bell pepper and replaced hot Italian turkey sausage with herb and sundried tomato chicken sausage. I also used small box of Pomi chopped tomatoes instead of chopped Roma tomatoes and added black pepper, garlic powder and onion powder. It was tasty and everyone enjoyed it.
great combo of flavors and colors, I use sweet sausage rather than the hot though

I really like this recipe. My mom uses turkey sausage to make regular spaghetti so I knew I would love the turkey sausage. I actually added mushrooms and I wish I added more basil to the recipe. Other than that, I love it and would definitely recommend it. I also added crushed red pepper which adds a nice kick to it. (Photo is without the noodles added yet)

item.name: Pasta Primavera with Italian Turkey Sausage
